definitions: person who lives in London, the capital city of England
examples: The Londoner navigated the tube system expertly during rush hour
Many Londoners enjoy spending weekends in Hyde Park

definitions: formal title used when addressing a lord or judge
territory or estate under the control of a lord
examples: Your Lordship presided over the court proceedings with fairness
The defendant addressed the judge as Your Lordship throughout
The lordship extended across three counties in medieval times
His lordship included several villages and farming estates

definitions: name for Satan or the devil, originally meaning light-bearer
old-fashioned term for a friction match used to make fire
examples: In Milton's epic, Lucifer rebels against heaven's authority
The painting depicted Lucifer falling from celestial heights
She struck a lucifer to light the gas lamp
The box of lucifers was kept safely away from children

definitions: aerial warfare branch of the German military, especially during World War II
examples: The Luftwaffe conducted bombing raids over London in 1940
Museum exhibits display vintage Luftwaffe aircraft and uniforms

definitions: projecting part or handle used for gripping or support
act of dragging or carrying something heavy with effort
examples: The mechanic tightened the lug nuts on the wheel
Each corner had metal lugs for secure attachment
We had to lug our suitcases up three flights
The movers will lug the furniture into the truck

definitions: semi-automatic pistol used by German military forces, designed by Georg Luger
examples: The collector displayed a vintage Luger from World War I
Military historians studied the Luger's innovative toggle-lock mechanism

definitions: Roman goddess of the moon in ancient mythology
poetic or scientific name for Earth's moon
examples: Ancient Romans built temples dedicated to Luna's worship
The artist depicted Luna riding her silver chariot
Luna's gravitational pull creates ocean tides on Earth
Astronomers observed Luna through powerful telescopes last night

definitions: person who follows the teachings of Martin Luther and belongs to the Lutheran church
examples: The Lutheran attended services at the local congregation weekly
Many Lutherans celebrate Reformation Day in October each year

definitions: branch of Protestant Christianity based on the teachings of Martin Luther
examples: Lutheranism emphasizes salvation through faith alone, not works
The spread of Lutheranism transformed religious practices across Europe

definitions: small constellation in the northern sky containing the bright star Vega
examples: Astronomers easily locate Lyra by finding its brightest star
The constellation Lyra represents the lyre of Orpheus

definitions: flat piece of material used for covering floors or surfaces
thick tangled mass of hair, fur, or vegetation
examples: Please wipe your feet on the door mat first
The yoga mat provided cushioning during exercise poses
The dog's fur formed mats that needed careful grooming
Dead leaves created a thick mat on the forest floor

definitions: Master of Business Administration, an advanced degree in business management
examples: She earned her MBA from a prestigious business school
Many executives pursue an MBA to advance their careers

definitions: psychoactive drug known as ecstasy, chemically 3,4-methylenedioxymethamphetamine
examples: Medical researchers study MDMA for potential therapeutic uses
Law enforcement seized illegal MDMA at the border checkpoint

definitions: bibliographic database of life sciences and biomedical information maintained by the National Library of Medicine
examples: Researchers searched Medline for recent studies on diabetes
The doctor consulted Medline to find relevant medical literature

definitions: informal abbreviation for medicine or medical
informal abbreviation for the Mediterranean Sea or region
examples: She's studying pre-med before applying to medical school
The med student spent long hours in the library
They sailed across the Med during their summer vacation
The Med climate features warm, dry summers year-round

definitions: Master of Fine Arts, an advanced degree in creative or performing arts
examples: The sculptor completed her MFA in studio art last year
Many writers pursue an MFA to refine their craft

definitions: megahertz, a unit of frequency equal to one million cycles per second
examples: The processor operates at a speed of 2400 MHz
Radio stations broadcast on specific MHz frequency bands

definitions: Musical Instrument Digital Interface, a technical standard for electronic musical instruments
examples: The keyboard connects to the computer through MIDI cables
Musicians use MIDI to compose and edit digital music

definitions: Moving Picture Experts Group, a standard for compressing video and audio files
examples: The video was compressed using MPEG format for streaming
Digital cameras often save videos as MPEG files

definitions: Magnetic Resonance Imaging, a medical scanning technique using magnetic fields
examples: The doctor ordered an MRI to examine the knee injury
MRI scans provide detailed images of soft tissues

definitions: monosodium glutamate, a food additive that enhances savory flavors
abbreviation for message in digital communications
examples: Some restaurants advertise food prepared without added MSG
MSG occurs naturally in tomatoes and aged cheeses
Please send me a msg when you arrive safely
The error msg appeared on the computer screen

definitions: Mountain Standard Time, the time zone for the Rocky Mountain region
examples: Denver operates on MST during the winter months
The conference call is scheduled for 2 PM MST

definitions: Master of Science, an advanced academic degree in scientific fields
examples: He earned his MSc in computer science from Cambridge
The MSc program requires two years of intensive study

definitions: Most Valuable Player, an award given to the best performing athlete
examples: The quarterback won MVP honors for the championship game
She received the MVP trophy after scoring thirty points

definitions: megawatt hour, a unit of energy equal to one thousand kilowatt hours
examples: The power plant generates several MWh of electricity daily
Industrial facilities monitor their energy consumption in MWh

definitions: tragic protagonist in Shakespeare's play, a Scottish general who becomes king
examples: The actor portrayed Macbeth with intense psychological depth
Students analyzed Macbeth's descent into tyranny and madness

definitions: ornamental staff carried as a symbol of authority
chemical spray used for self-defense derived from pepper
examples: The university president carried the ceremonial mace during graduation
Parliament's sergeant-at-arms bears the mace into the chamber
She carries mace in her purse for personal protection
Security guards are trained in proper mace deployment

definitions: person from Macedonia or the language spoken in North Macedonia
examples: The Macedonian shared traditional recipes from her homeland
Students enrolled in Macedonian language classes at the university

definitions: ratio of an object's speed to the speed of sound
examples: The fighter jet exceeded Mach 2 during the test flight
Supersonic aircraft travel faster than Mach 1

definitions: person who uses cunning and duplicity in politics, named after Niccol√≤ Machiavelli
examples: The Machiavellian manipulated allies to gain political power
Critics labeled him a Machiavellian for his ruthless tactics

definitions: person from Madagascar, the island nation off the eastern coast of Africa
examples: The Madagascan explained unique customs from her island home
Many Madagascans speak both Malagasy and French fluently

definitions: artistic representation of the Virgin Mary, often with baby Jesus
American pop singer and cultural icon born Madonna Louise Ciccone
examples: The Renaissance madonna painting hung in the cathedral
Pilgrims prayed before the ancient madonna statue
Madonna performed her greatest hits at the stadium concert
The documentary explored Madonna's influence on pop culture

definitions: organized crime syndicate originating in Italy, characterized by codes of silence and loyalty
examples: Federal agents investigated mafia involvement in the construction industry
The movie depicted mafia families competing for territorial control

definitions: bright purple-red color between red and blue in the color spectrum
examples: The artist mixed magenta paint for the sunset sky
She wore a striking magenta dress to the gala

definitions: wise men or astrologers who visited baby Jesus, also called the Three Kings
examples: The magi followed the star to find the newborn king
Christmas pageants often feature children playing the magi

definitions: Mary's song of praise from the Gospel of Luke, often set to music
examples: The choir performed Bach's Magnificat during the Christmas service
Medieval monks chanted the Magnificat at evening prayers

definitions: ancient Indian epic poem about the struggle between two groups of cousins
examples: Scholars study the Mahabharata for insights into ancient Indian society
The Mahabharata contains the famous Bhagavad Gita philosophical dialogue

definitions: major branch of Buddhism emphasizing universal salvation and compassion for all beings
examples: Mahayana Buddhism spread throughout East Asia over centuries
The temple follows Mahayana teachings and practices

definitions: prophesied redeemer in Islamic belief who will restore justice before judgment day
examples: Some Muslims believe the Mahdi will appear during troubled times
Historical figures have claimed to be the awaited Mahdi

definitions: container or envelope designed for sending items through postal service
computer program or service that sends email messages
examples: The company sent promotional materials in branded mailers
Padded mailers protect fragile items during shipping
The email mailer automatically sends newsletters to subscribers
Configure the mailer settings to use your SMTP server

definitions: person who shoots arrows with a bow, especially as a sport
examples: The archer drew her bow and aimed at the target
Medieval archers played crucial roles in battlefield victories

definitions: northernmost region of Earth surrounding the North Pole, characterized by extreme cold
examples: Scientists study climate change effects in the Arctic region
Arctic animals have adapted to survive extreme cold

definitions: large country in South America known for tango, beef, and diverse landscapes
examples: Argentina produces some of the world's finest wines
Tourists visit Argentina to see Patagonia's stunning glaciers
